snippet: Researchers found evidence of long-term degeneration in the brains of athletes, including John Mackey and Derek Boogaard, military veterans and others.
abstract: Study conducted by investigators at Boston University Center for the Study of Traumatic Encephalopathy and the Veterans Affairs Boston Healthcare System, in collaboration with the Sports Legacy Institute, bolsters link between routine hits to head and long-term brain disease; 80 percent of people tested, nearly all of whom played sports, showed evidence of chronic traumatic encephalopathy, or CTE, degenerative and incurable disease whose symptoms can include memory loss, depression and dementia.
lead_paragraph: Researchers found evidence of long-term degeneration in the brains of athletes, including John Mackey and Derek Boogaard, military veterans and others.
